subject: Re: [LH] Kate is everywhere
body:
I have always maintained that they are the same 
word, merely different pronunciations thereof.  It's the result of British 
English being a non-rhotic language, i.e, the final "r" in "gaffer" (or in 
"miller" or indeed in "Richard") isn't pronounced.
 
Richard

----- Original Message ----- 
From: Spielas 
Alan 
To: love-hounds@gaffa.org 
Sent: Friday, June 08, 2007 2:50 PM
Subject: Re: [LH] Kate is everywhere 
 

P.S. And to those who still claim that "gaffa tape" is 
not synonymouswith "gaffer's tape", please Google "gaffa tape" to have your 
profoundmisconception corrected.-- No virus found in this 
incoming message.Checked by AVG Free Edition. Version: 7.5.472 / Virus
